content.stem:
At a local fair, the price of admission includes the opportunity for a person to spin a wheel for free ride tickets.

 

  • Each spin of the wheel is a random event.

  • The result from each spin of the wheel is independent of the results of previous spins.

  • Each spin of the wheel awards tickets according to the probabilities shown below.

 

Spin the Wheel

1 ticket

35%

2 tickets

25%

3 tickets

20%

5 tickets

15%

10 tickets

5%

 

Let X be the number of tickets a person wins based on 2 spins. There are 13 possible values for X.

 

Some values of X are more common than others. For example, winning only 2 tickets in 2 spins is a somewhat

common occurrence with probability 0.1225. It means the person wins 1 ticket on the first spin and 1 ticket on

the second spin . A list of the possible values of X and the corresponding probabilities for most

values of X is shown below.

 

Fill in the three missing probability values in the table.

 

X  

Probability

2

0.1225

3

0.1750

4

_

5

0.1000

6

0.1450

7

0.0750

8

0.0600

10

_

11

0.0350

12

0.0250

13

_

15

0.0150

20

0.0025

readAloud.textToSpeechPronunciation: Wheel. The table has two columns and 5 rows.
From left to right the first row reeds, 1

table. The table has two columns and 13 rows. From left to right the column headings reed, X, probability. From left to right the first row reeds, 2, zero point 1 2 2 5. The second row reeds, 3, 0 point 1 7 5 0. The third row reeds 4, box. The fourth row reeds, 5, 0 point 1 0 0 0. The fifth row reeds, 6, 0 point 1 4 5 0. The sixth row reeds, 7, 0 point 0 7 5 0. The seventh row reeds, 8, 0 point 0 6 0 0. The eighth row reeds, 10, box. The ninth row reeds, 11, 0 point 0 3 5 0. The tenth row reeds, 12, 0 point 0 2 5 0. The eleventh row reeds, 13, box. The twelfth row reeds, 15, 0 point 0 1 5 0. The thirteenth row reeds, 20, 0 point 0 0 2 5.

content.stem:
En una feria de la localidad, el precio de la entrada incluye la oportunidad de que la persona gire una ruleta para ganar boletos para subirse a las atracciones gratuitamente.

 

  • Cada giro de la ruleta es un evento aleatorio.

  • El resultado de cada giro de la ruleta es independiente de los resultados de los giros anteriores.

  • Cada giro de la ruleta otorga boletos de acuerdo con las probabilidades que se muestran a continuación.

 

Giro de la ruleta

1 boleto

35%

2 boletos

25%

3 boletos

20%

5 boletos

15%

10 boletos

5%

 

Sea X el número de boletos que una persona gana basada en 2 giros. Hay 13 valores posibles para X.

 

Algunos valores de X son más comunes que otros. Por ejemplo, ganar solo 2 boletos en 2 giros es relativamente común con una probabilidad de 0.1225. Esto significa que la persona gana 1 boleto en el primer giro y 1 boleto en el segundo giro . A continuación se muestra una lista de los valores de X posibles y las probabilidades correspondientes para la mayoría de los valores de X.

 

Completa los tres valores de probabilidades que faltan en la tabla.

X  

Probabilidad

2

0.1225

3

0.1750

4

_

5

0.1000

6

0.1450

7

0.0750

8

0.0600

10

_

11

0.0350

12

0.0250

13

_

15

0.0150

20

0.0025

From left to right the first row reeds, 1

table. The table has two columns and 13 rows. From left to right the column headings reed, X, probability. From left to right the first row reeds, 2, zero point 1 2 2 5. The second row reeds, 3, 0 point 1 7 5 0. The third row reeds 4, box. The fourth row reeds, 5, 0 point 1 0 0 0. The fifth row reeds, 6, 0 point 1 4 5 0. The sixth row reeds, 7, 0 point 0 7 5 0. The seventh row reeds, 8, 0 point 0 6 0 0. The eighth row reeds, 10, box. The ninth row reeds, 11, 0 point 0 3 5 0. The tenth row reeds, 12, 0 point 0 2 5 0. The eleventh row reeds, 13, box. The twelfth row reeds, 15, 0 point 0 1 5 0. The thirteenth row reeds, 20, 0 point 0 0 2 5.
